text: {{Infobox person | name = Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton | image = Mrs. Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton.jpg | caption = Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton by Ralph Earl, 1787 | birth_name = Elizabeth Schuyler | birth_date = | birth_place = Albany, Province of New York, Thirteen Colonies | death_date = | death_place = Washington, D.C., U.S. | resting_place = Trinity Church Cemetery | spouse = | children = | parents = | relatives = See Schuyler family | other names = Eliza, Betsey }} Elizabeth Hamilton (née Schuyler ; August 9, 1757 – November 9, 1854), also called Eliza or Betsey, was a socialite and philanthropist. She was from the wealthy and slave owning Van Rensselaer and Schuyler families. She was married to American founding father Alexander Hamilton. She was a defender of his works, a mother, and co-founder and deputy director of Graham Windham, the first private orphanage in New York City. ==References== Category:1757 births Category:1854 deaths Category:American philanthropists Category:Socialites Category:People from Albany, New York Category:Slavers
title: Elizabeth Schuyler Hamilton
